span.span: We miss you! Please click below to see a

span.style: background-color: rgb(255, 255, 0); text-decoration: underline; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(149, 55, 52);

strong.style: color: rgb(15, 36, 62); font-family: Georgia; font-size: large;

p.style: font-weight: bold; font-size: x-large; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

p.span: The April 22, 2020 Farmingdale School District Board of Education Meeting will be conducted virtually in light of Executive Order 107’s mandate for all citizens to avoid any unnecessary travel or social gatherings, as well as to remain home or in their place of residence.

The meeting will begin at 7:30 p.m. Please use the following link to access the virtual meeting and meeting documents: http://farmingdaleschool.com/AboutOurSchool/TheBoardofEducation.aspx. It will be necessary to dial into the meeting using a phone.

Dear Farmingdale Families. We know this is a difficult time for you at home and we wanted to let you know we are here for you. In an effort to provide you with support and shape our practices to best suit your needs, we have developed a survey to get your feedback. We would greatly appreciate if you can take a few minutes to complete it. You may access the survey link by clicking the link below or looking under Helpful Links to the right of the page. Please complete one survey for each child you have in Farmingdale School. Thank you in advance for your assistance.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

p.span: Welcome to the Farmingdale School website! We are so glad you took the time to visit.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

p.span: Our school is currently closed. The main office is staffed on a limited basis. However, all staff are working remotely and are here to provide support each day. Please see below for contact information.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

p.span: Please see our school closure plan below:

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

strong.style: color: rgb(112, 48, 160); font-family: Georgia; font-size: x-large;
color: rgb(112, 48, 160); font-family: Georgia; font-size: x-large;
color: rgb(112, 48, 160); font-family: Georgia; font-size: x-large; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 0);

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);
font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);
font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);
font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

p.span: Contact: As you navigate remote learning, please feel free to email your child's teacher, our principal or the school secretary. You are also welcome to leave a voicemail message if calling the school. We are able to retrieve voicemails remotely and will be checking periodically. Please leave an email address where we can respond.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

p.span: Office Hours: Starting the week of March 23 and until further notice, the Farmingdale school office will be physically open on Mondays and Thursdays, and staff will be working remotely on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. All staff are available via email throughout the week and will be responding as soon as possible.

Meal Distribution: Meals are currently being distributed on Mondays for Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday and on Thursdays for Thursday and Friday. Both distributions are from 11:30-12:00. This takes place at the front door by the main office. If you have any questions, please call the school. We are able to retrieve voicemails remotely.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);
font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);
font-size: large; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

span.span: Due to the ongoing closure of our school, we are extending the due date for Preschool applications and lifting the requirement to drop them off in person. Completed application packets may be mailed to the school or emailed to
. If mailed, your application must be postmarked by May 13, and please notify us by email or voicemail so we may reach out if we have not received it as the deadline approaches.

p.span: Your completed packet must contain all of the forms with the exception of the original birth certificate, Universal Health Record, and immunization record. These three documents will be accepted in person once our school reopens. We will be in touch to make those arrangements.
Preschool students must attain the age of 3 on or prior to October 1 in order to register.

span.style: font-size: medium; font-family: Georgia; color: rgb(112, 48, 160);

p.span: Thank you for your interest in our preschool program.

div.br:
Kindergarten registration is also underway, but there is no hard deadline to submit applications. Students must attain the age of 5 on or before October 1 in order to register.
Registration packets for Pre-K and K-8 may be found under the Helpful Links section on the right side of our home page or by clicking on the appropriate link below:
Preschool Registration Packet (open Monday 3/9/20 - Wednesday 5/13/2020)
K-8 Registration Packet (2020-2021)
Preschool paperwork is due by Wednesday, May 13.
Please feel free to contact the school should you have any questions.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Census 2020
Please click on the link below or to the right under Helpful Links for important information about the 2020 United States Census.
2020 US Census Information
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Interested in Before Care or After Care for the 2019-2020 school year? Please click on the Howell PAL link below and scroll down to the Farmingdale option. Both Before and After Care will take place at Farmingdale School.
Howell PAL Before/After Care
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Registration for the 2019-2020 school year has begun. Pre-K students must attain the age of 3 on or prior to October 1 and be potty-trained in order to register. Kindergarten students must attain the age of 5 on or before October 1 in order to register. Registration packets for Pre-K and K-8 may be found under the Helpful Links section on the right side of our home page or by clicking on the appropriate link below:
Pre-K Registration 2019-2020 (current year. 20-21 registration not yet open)
K-8 Registration 2019-2020 (current year. See side link for 20-21 registration)
Please feel free to contact the school should you have any questions.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You can now follow us on Facebook as well as Twitter to see all the smart work that is going on in our classrooms at www.facebook/FarmingdalePublicSchool. Please check it out!!!
The Farmingdale School Staff looks forward to partnering with you to ensure a successful and engaging school year jam-packed with exciting learning experiences for all students!
Please feel free to reach out to any one of us with concerns, comments or relevant news.
We are only an email or phone call away!!
In education,
Mrs. Edith Conroy
